title: Don Juan
brief_description: Don Juan is a 1926 American romantic adventure film directed by Alan Crosland and starring John Barrymore. It is the first feature-length film to utilise the Vitaphone sound-on-disc sound system with a synchronised musical score and sound effects, though it has no spoken dialogue.

constellations_other.name: Sound and Hollywood
constellations_other.description: The impact of sound on Tinsel Town stretches from the beginning of cinema to recent award-winners, as well as the biggest band in K-Pop.

description: Don Juan is a 1926 American romantic adventure film directed by Alan Crosland and starring John Barrymore. It is the first feature-length film to utilise the Vitaphone sound-on-disc sound system with a synchronised musical score and sound effects, though it has no spoken dialogue. The film has the most kisses in film history, with Barrymore kissing (all together) Mary Astor and Estelle Taylor 127 times.

The film has the most kisses in film history, with Barrymore kissing (all together) Mary Astor and Estelle Taylor 127 times.
